text:
README.configure states that, "This [--enable-modules= most \
--enable-shares=max as parameters to ./configure] first enables most of the
modules (all modules except some problematic ones like mod_auth_db ...". But,
when configuring with these parameters, ./configure states, "o dbm_auth_module
uses ConfigStart/End", and make fails with "mod_auth_dbm.c:84:18: ndbm.h: file
or directory not found".
I'm not sure if this is a bug or just some misleading info in the README.

The workaround is simple : adding --disable-module=auth_dbm to ./configure
solves the problem.
creator: reo@gmx.at
slive@apache.org
text:
If you look closely, you'll see that README.configure says that "mod_auth_db"
is not activated.  The module you are having a problem with is "mod_auth_dbm",
which is a different module.  So, I don't think there is any documentation
problem here, nor a build problem.  And you have already found the best
solution.

Thanks for using Apache!

creator: kzembower@jhuccp.org
text:
I'm experiencing a similar problem building apache 1.3.24. My make fails with:
In file included from mod_rewrite.c:93:
mod_rewrite.h:133: ndbm.h: No such file or directory

I note in the output of configure, the line:
 + using -ldb1 for DBM support
      enabling DBM support for mod_rewrite

I don't know how to turn this off without disabling mod_rewrite, which I don't 
want to do.  I would be happy to install ndbm, but can't find it anywhere. I 
tried installing the Berkeley DB software, but this doesn't seem to help.

Please let me know if there is any other information I can provide to help you 
help me solve this problem. Thanks.

-Kevin Zembower

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
This is not an apache bug.  This is a problem in your system configuration.
In particular: You have a dbm library that apache found during your configuration,
but you don't have the header file necessary to link with it.  You need to
either prevent apache from trying to link with the dbm library (adding
 -DNO_DBM_REWRITEMAP to CFLAGS will probably work) or you need to set your
INCLUDES path to find the appropriate header files.

Since this is not a bug, it should be addressed in a user support forum like
http://httpd.apache.org/userslist.html
not in the bug database.

Thanks.
